00019 /** @file rsXXX.h
00020  *
00021  * Communication function for RS232 and RS485 interfaces
00022  *
00023  * Normally there should not be any need to call these directly.
00024  */
00025 #ifndef __TMCL_RSXXX_H_
00026 #define __TMCL_RSXXX_H_
00027 
00028 #if HAVE_CONFIG_H
00029 #include <config.h>
00030 #endif /* HAVE_CONFIG_H */
00031 
00032 #include <tmcl/tmcldefs.h>
00033 #include <tmcl/interface.h>
00034 
00035 /** Opens the RSXXX port
00036  *
00037  * \arg \c filename: Device node of RSXXX port
00038  * \arg \c pointer: NOT USED!
00039  *
00040  * Returns:
00041  *       - File descriptor of RSXXX port on success
00042  *       - -1 on failure
00043  *
00044  */
00045 int tmcl_open_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, const char* filename, void *pointer);
00046 
00047 /** Closes the RSXXX port
00048  *
00049  *  \arg \c pointer: NOT USED!
00050  *
00051  * Returns:
00052  *       -  0 on success
00053  *       - -1 on failure
00054  */
00055 int tmcl_close_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, void *pointer);
00056 
00057 /** Writes to RSXXX port
00058  *
00059  * \arg \c buf: buffer of data to be written
00060  * \arg \c length: length of data buffer
00061  * \arg \c pointer: NOT USED!
00062  *
00063  *
00064  * Returns:
00065  *       -  0 on success
00066  *       - -1 on failure
00067  */
00068 int tmcl_write_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, const void *buf, int length, void *pointer);
00069 
00070 /** Waits for data from the RSXXX port.
00071  *
00072  * \arg \c buffer: Buffer to store received data
00073  * \arg \c pointer: NOT USED!
00074  * RETURNS
00075  *       - >0: length of data read (in bytes)
00076  *       - -1 on failure
00077  *       - -2 on wrong length of read data
00078  */
00079 int tmcl_poll_rsXXX(TMCLInterface *iface, char *buffer, void *pointer);
00080         
00081 #endif /* __TMCL_RS232_H_ */
